segments.text: I notice the boy standing on that wobbly stool, reaching for the cookie jar like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His stool looks like it’s about to tip over any second, but he doesn’t seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He’s got one hand in the jar and the other holding a plate, probably to catch the cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think he’s going to fall and hurt himself if he’s not careful.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl next to him is just standing there, waiting for her share like it’s the most natural thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the way she’s looking up at him, so trusting, like she knows he’ll give her one.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if they’ve done this before and gotten away with it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman at the sink has no idea what’s happening right behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the stool doesn’t tip over and send him crashing into the wet floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene feels like a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR
